question_text: Which scenario best describes when 802.11 ad hoc mode would be used for printer connectivity?
answer_options: When multiple users on a network need to share a printer
When no access point is available and one device needs direct connection
When Bluetooth is unavailable and long-range wireless is needed
When a printer connects via Ethernet but uses Wi-Fi as a backup
correct_answer: When no access point is available and one device needs direct connection
explanation: Ad hoc mode allows point-to-point wireless connections without a centralized access pointâ€”useful for direct, local communication.
